name: Barbarian
description: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a primal rage

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer's Pack, and 15 GP; or (B) 75 GP

name: Bard
description: A master of song, speech, and the magic they contain

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Leather Armor, 2 Daggers, Musical Instrument of your choice, Entertainer's Pack, and 19 GP; or (B) 90 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Bard spell list. Dancing Lights and Vicious Mockery are recommended.
Whenever you gain a Bard level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list.
When you reach Bard levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list.

info.name: Spell Slots
desc: The Bard Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the Bard spell list. Charm Person, Color Spray, Dissonant Whispers, and Healing Word are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Bard levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Bard Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Bard spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Bard Features table.
Additionally, whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace one spell on your list with another Bard spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Bard spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Bard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus for your Bard spells.

name: Cleric
description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, or Religion

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Chain Shirt, Shield, Mace, Holy Symbol, Priest's Pack, and 7 GP; or (B) 110 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know three cantrips of your choice from the Cleric spell list. Guidance, Sacred Flame, and Thaumaturgy are recommended.
Whenever you gain a Cleric level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Cleric spell list.

info.name: Spell Slots
desc: The Cleric Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the Cleric spell list. Cure Wounds and Detect Magic are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Cleric levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Cleric Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Cleric spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Cleric Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
Additionally, whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace one spell on your list with another Cleric spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Cleric spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Wisdom whenever a Cleric spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your Cleric spells.

name: Druid
description: A priest of nature, wielding elemental forces and transforming into animals

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Animal Handling, Arcana, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, or Survival

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Leather Armor, Shield, Scimitar, Druidcraft focus, Explorers Pack, and 9 GP; or (B) 50 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Druid spell list. Druidcraft and Produce Flame are recommended.
Whenever you gain a Druid level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Druid spell list.

info.name: Spell Slots
desc: The Druid Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the Druid spell list. Animal Friendship and Cure Wounds are recommended.
The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Druid levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Druid Features table.
Additionally, whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace one spell on your list with another Druid spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Druid spells, since your magic draws upon your devotion and attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use a druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your Druid spells.

name: Fighter
description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, or Survival

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Chain Mail, Shield, Martial weapon, 2 Handaxes, Dungeoneer's Pack, and 4 GP; or (B) 155 GP

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Insight, Religion, or Stealth

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Spear, 5 Javelins, Explorer's Pack, and 11 GP; or (B) 50 GP

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, Medicine, Persuasion, or Religion

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Chain Mail, Shield, Javelin (6), Holy Symbol, Explorer's Pack, and 9 GP; or (B) 150 GP

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. You prepare a number of spells equal to half your Paladin level (round up) + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 spell).

The prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Paladin, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

info.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
desc: Whenever you gain a Paladin level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Paladin spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Paladin spells.

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use a Holy Symbol as a Spellcasting Focus for your Paladin spells.

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 3: Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Studded Leather Armor, Scimitar, Shortsword, Longbow, 20 Arrows, Quiver, Explorer's Pack, and 7 GP; or (B) 150 GP

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. You prepare a number of spells equal to half your Ranger level (round up) + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 spell).
The prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Ranger, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

info.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
desc: Whenever you gain a Ranger level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Ranger spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Ranger spells.

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use a Druidcraft Focus as a Spellcasting Focus for your Ranger spells.

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 4: Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Performance, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, or Stealth

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Leather Armor, 2 Daggers, Thieves' Tools, Burglar's Pack, and 8 GP; or (B) 100 GP

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Arcana, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Persuasion, or Religion

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Spear, 2 Daggers, Arcane Focus (crystal), Dungeoneer's Pack, and 28 GP; or (B) 50 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know four Sorcerer cantrips of your choice. Light, Prestidigitation, Shocking Grasp, and Sorcerous Burst are recommended. Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Sorcerer levels 4 and 10, you learn another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice.

info.name: Spell Slots
desc: The Sorcerer Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Long Rest.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Sorcerer spells. Burning Hands and Detect Magic are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Sorcerer levels. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Sorcerer spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Sorcerer Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

If another Sorcerer feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Sorcerer spells for you.

info.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
desc: Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Sorcerer spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Sorcerer spells.

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use an Arcane Focus as a Spellcasting Focus for your Sorcerer spells.

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Arcana, Deception, History, Intimidation, Investigation, Nature, or Religion

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Leather Armor, Scimitar, Simple weapon, 2 Daggers, Arcane Focus, Scholar's Pack, and 9 GP; or (B) 100 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know two Warlock cantrips of your choice. Eldritch Blast and Prestidigitation are recommended. Whenever you gain a Warlock level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Warlock cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Warlock levels 4 and 10, you learn another Warlock cantrip of your choice.

info.name: Spell Slots
desc: The Warlock Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ Warlock spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a Short Rest or Long Rest.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. You prepare a number of spells equal to your Charisma modifier + half your Warlock level (round up), minimum of 1 spell.

The prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Warlock, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

info.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
desc: Whenever you gain a Warlock level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Warlock spell for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Warlock spells.

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use an Arcane Focus as a Spellcasting Focus for your Warlock spells.

proficiency_choices.desc: Choose 2: Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, or Religion

starting_equipment_options.desc: Choose A or B: (A) Dagger (2), Arcane Focus (quarterstaff), Robe, Scholar's Pack, Spellbook, and 28 GP; or (B) 100 GP

info.name: Cantrips
desc: You know three Wizard cantrips of your choice. Light, Mage Hand, and Prestidigitation are recommended. Whenever you gain a Wizard level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Wizard cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Wizard levels 4 and 10, you learn another Wizard cantrip of your choice.

info.name: Spellbook
desc: Your spellbook contains six level 1 Wizard spells of your choice. Detect Magic, Feather Fall, Mage Armor, Magic Missile, Shield, and Sleep are recommended.

The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse.

info.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
desc: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. You prepare a number of spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Wizard level (minimum of 1 spell).

The prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Wizard, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of level 1 or 2 from your spellbook in any combination.

info.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
desc: Whenever you gain a Wizard level, you can replace one spell on your list with another spell from your spellbook for which you have spell slots.

info.name: Spellcasting Ability
desc: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Wizard spells.

info.name: Spellcasting Focus
desc: You can use an Arcane Focus as a Spellcasting Focus for your Wizard spells.
